meanings.definition: A large flightless bird native to Africa, with a long neck and legs and the ability to run at high speeds.
meanings.sent1: The ostrich swiftly ran across the savanna.
meanings.sent2: I saw an ostrich at the zoo with a very long neck.
meanings.sent3: The ostrich challenged the cheetah to a race for fun.
meanings.sent4: Her running speed was like that of an ostrich escaping danger.
meanings.sent5: The ostrich's long legs helped it move quickly in the wild.

meanings.definition: A person who refuses to face reality or difficult situations.
meanings.sent1: She's such an ostrich, always avoiding the truth.
meanings.sent2: Don't be an ostrich, deal with your problems head-on.
meanings.sent3: Being an ostrich won't make your responsibilities disappear.
meanings.sent4: He's an ostrich burying his head in the sand when things get tough.
meanings.sent5: Facing challenges is better than being an ostrich and pretending they don't exist.
